intro: Epitrachys adunca, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant features small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are narrow and often covered in a fine layer of white hairs. Epitrachys adunca is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many other spurge species known for their milky sap.
